titleStmt.title: Description of Penitential prayers for the intermediate nights of Rosh ha-Shanah and for the two nights of the festival, according to a North African rite.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Add MS 19782: Penitential prayers for the intermediate nights of Rosh ha-Shanah and for the two nights of the festival, according to a North African rite. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal page for usage details, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Penitential prayers for the intermediate nights of Rosh ha-Shanah and for the two nights of the festival, according to a North African rite.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental (North African) semi-cursive and square script of the 17th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, blind tooled. Boxed. Spine: 'Selichoth. Preces Expiatorie Et In Festo Novi Anni. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 19,782.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: M. Aschkenazi: purchased from him by the British Museum through D. Nutt on 13 May 1854: inscribed, folio [76v].
